prompt: Photorealistic close-up of a vintage 1960s Bulova Accutron Spaceview watch, positioned slightly off-center to the left against a dark, subtly textured background. The skeleton dial revealing the intricate tuning fork movement is the main focus. Soft, directional studio lighting highlights the polished steel case, the green electronic components, and the patina on the hands. Shallow depth of field blurs the background, emphasizing the watch's details and craftsmanship. Professional product photography style. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: old-bulova-watches-value-image-1.png

prompt: A meticulously arranged flat lay composition of five diverse vintage Bulova watches from different eras (1940s-1970s), including Art Deco styles, military issues, and early automatics. The watches are displayed horizontally across a weathered wooden watchmaker's bench. Natural window light streams in from the side, creating soft shadows and highlighting the varied textures of dials, cases (gold-filled, steel), and leather/metal bands. Focus is sharp across all watches, showcasing their condition and design evolution. Professional, informative style. --ar 16:9
name: old-bulova-watches-value-image-2.png

prompt: Over-the-shoulder shot focusing on a watch appraiser's hands carefully examining a 1950s Bulova automatic watch with a jeweler's loupe. The watch rests on a velvet pad. Tools like tweezers and a caseback opener are visible but slightly blurred in the foreground and background on a workbench. Warm, focused task lighting illuminates the watch face and the appraiser's hands. The scene conveys expertise and the process of valuation. Photorealistic, documentary style. --ar 16:9
name: old-bulova-watches-value-image-3.png

prompt: Still life composition featuring a well-preserved, gold-toned vintage Bulova watch from the 1950s, placed elegantly beside its original clamshell presentation box and faded warranty papers. The watch face shows slight, authentic patina. The items are arranged on a rich mahogany surface. Dramatic, warm side lighting casts long shadows, emphasizing the nostalgia and the importance of provenance in determining value. Cinematic, professional photo style. --ar 16:9
name: old-bulova-watches-value-image-4.png

prompt: A wide shot showcasing three distinct ladies' vintage Bulova Art Deco watches from the 1920s-1930s, arranged gracefully across the frame on a dark grey slate surface. One watch features intricate case engraving, another has enamel details, and the third a unique geometric shape. Soft, diffused gallery lighting illuminates the watches evenly, highlighting their delicate designs, gemstone accents (if any), and period aesthetics. Elegant, museum-quality photography. --ar 16:9 --style raw
